title: URDF parser does not handle the initial model pose

content.raw:
Spawning URDF models at poses other than the default does not work with Gazebo 1.8.6 and the spawn_model service in the current hydro-devel branch of [gazebo_ros_pkgs](https://github.com/osrf/gazebo_ros_pkgs/tree/45d28d9716a0694d3df3bfa16b56e7dd59fc8a81). The robot will always be spawned at the default 0 pose.

The `spawn_model` service handler in the gazebo_ros_api_plugin adds a `<origin>...</origin>` tag to the robot description and calls gazebo's factory service internally. I did not find any code in `parser_urdf.cc` that reads this tag and adds a `<pose>` tag to the SDF description. So this issue could IMHO be solved

1. by converting the `<origin>` tag to a `<pose>` tag in the URDF parser or
2. with a modification of the gazebo_ros_api_plugin in gazebo_ros package, e.g. by passing the model pose within a gazebo extension that the URDF parser does not touch.

As other elements use the `<origin>` tag too I assume that 1. is the intended behavior and model origin support has been dropped accidentally, as it used to work in the gazebo version shipped with groovy.
